content.question: The velocity of a particle moving along a straight line is given by <math alttext="v of t equals, 1.3 t, times the natural log of, open parenthesis, 0.2 t, plus 0.4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1.3</mn><mi>t</mi><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>0.4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the acceleration of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
